description: {"blocks":[{"key":"8gh5","text":"Recto- vaginal samples collections usually practice to pregnant women because Streptococcus agalactiae  a bacterial pathogen frequently carried in the normal fecal and/or vaginal flora but also is one of the most importants pathogens involve on neonates infections. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":70},{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9su8c","text":"Remove swab from packaging and insert swab 2 cm into vagina, followed by the rectum, insert swab 1 cm through the anal sphincter using the same swab. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bvks8","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4vuvi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"c9ng3","text":"NOTE: Cervical, perianal, perirectal or perianal specimens are not acceptable, and a speculum should not be used for culture collection. Do not touch the cotton end with your fingers. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"90m5a","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"698pg","text":"Place the swab (s) into a nonnutritive transport medium. Apropriate transport systems (e.g, Stuarts or Amies with or without charcoal) are commercialy available. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9hb5g","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1s8fv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[{"length":25,"offset":26,"style":"italic"}],"key":"904tt","text":"NOTE: Recovery of group B Streptococcus agalactiae (GBS) isolates declines over one to four days, especially at elevated temperatures, which can lead to false negative results. When feasible, specimens should be refrigerated before processing. ","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"86oku","text":"","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7af4t","text":"Specimen requisitions should indicate clearly that specimes are for group B Streptococcal testing. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":76,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"11bac","text":"For sample processing, the swab is removed from the transport system and inoculated into blood agar plates, streaked to isolate, and incubated at   for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":146,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":152,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"98rd3","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"426A99A057F111ECA9DA7BE32A7EF052","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"490741F057F111ECA9DA7BE32A7EF052","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}
